Dialogue_Line: Ten years ago,
on a night just like this one,
there were three youths who went camping together...
Little did they know
that they were embarking on a journey
that would change their world!
<laughs>
Can you make it any more obvious that this is about us?
Sure!  It was a girl named Lindsay, and her brother, and her best friend.
Let me guess, and the brother and the friend were dating each other?
God no, that would be too awful.
Right, because it bothers you *so much*.
I can't even sleep at night.
Hey, we're not THAT loud, are we?
Johnny!
Awww, she knows it was a joke.
Don't joke about things like that.
<mumbles> Sorry...
So... can I get back to my story?
Maybe we should stock up on firewood first - we're getting a little low.
Good idea, it's almost too dark to do it already.
Fine.  I'd barely gotten started anyway.  <mock glare>
That would be me.
My brother, Johnny.
My good friend Sarah.
Little sis.
Me!  Ain't I gorgeous?
Lindsay's hot friend, and recently, my girlfriend: Sarah.
My best friend, Lindsay.
Lindsay's brother.  I'm... kind of dating him.
That's me.
Nice try.
He's my brother!
You'd like that, wouldn't you?
Ew.
Not here.
Not here.
We're just friends.
Not right now.
Nah.
It looks perfect for firewood.
Aha!  I found one.
A fine specimen of stick.
It's dry, which is all that I care about.
Might be fun to smooth it down and make a walking stick.  Or stilts!
Nice and dry, as firewood should be.
That's probably enough.  Let's go back.
I'm already holding plenty.  Let the others carry their share.
Roll or click the mouse wheel, or press Q or E, to switch characters.
Some puzzles in this game will need the right person at the right time.
Ehh, all these sticks are pretty awkward.  The girls won't mind helping.
Remember, use Q or E or the mouse wheel to switch characters.
Some puzzles in this game will need the right person at the right time.
Surely I shouldn't have to hold so many of these myself.
Remember, use Q or E or the mouse wheel to switch characters.
Some puzzles in this game will need the right person at the right time.
We don't need to go that far.  Let's just collect some of the dead branches we've seen.
It's getting dark and we have plenty of firewood.  Let's go back.
Let's collect some firewood before we go.
We haven't collected very much firewood.  Let's grab a few more.
That's really odd.  We should be back by now.
But what would I say?
Let's not waste time.
I could talk to myself all day -- but would you want to listen?
Let's get the firewood and get back.
I want to finish my story.
Let's just get the firewood and get back.
I want to finish my story.
Let's get the firewood so I can make fun of her story some more.
Let's get the firewood so we can make fun of Lindsay's story some more.
Let's just get the firewood before it gets too dark.
Let's just get the firewood before it gets too dark.
This is the way we came, right?
Yeah, it is.
It doesn't make any sense.  We went in a straight line.
We must have gotten turned around.
I guess so?
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
A bit gloomy, but otherwise nice enough.
A bit gloomy, but otherwise nice enough.
A bit gloomy, but otherwise nice enough.
A bit gloomy, but otherwise nice enough.
A bit gloomy, but otherwise nice enough.
Do mine eyes deceive me?
Trees, trees, more trees... and something else.
It's really dark out, now.  I think I see something, though.
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
It's looking gloomier than it was earlier.
Or just let her get the next one.
Or just let him get the next one.
Or just let her get the next one.
Still doesn't quite reach.  Sorry.
I don't think that's a good idea.
The trees are soft but rough.  Hm... neat line for a poem, maybe.
The trees are soft but rough.  Hm... neat line for a poem, maybe.
The trees are soft but rough.  Hm... neat line for a poem, maybe.

It's tempting to carve "J + S" in one... but better not.

It's been ages since I've climbed a tree!
It's been ages since I've climbed a tree!
It's been ages since I've climbed a tree!
It's been ages since I've climbed a tree!
It's been ages since I've climbed a tree!
It's been ages since I've climbed a tree!
It's been ages since I've climbed a tree!
But it's getting dark and we can always come back tomorrow.
But it's getting dark and we can always come back tomorrow.
But it's getting dark and we can always come back tomorrow.
But it's getting dark and we can always come back tomorrow.
But it's getting dark and we can always come back tomorrow.
But it's getting dark and we can always come back tomorrow.
But it's getting dark and we can always come back tomorrow.
I actually prefer the quiet.  The forest is so serene.
I actually prefer the quiet.  The forest is so serene.

Echo!-o-o-o-o.... Nah, it's not working.
Echo!-o-o-o-o.... Nah, it's not working.

Hello?  Anybody there?  ...Guess not.
Hello?  Anybody there?  ...Guess not.
Hello?  Anybody there?  ...Guess not.
Hello?  Anybody there?  ...Guess not.
Hello?  Anybody there?  ...Guess not.
Hello?  Anybody there?  ...Guess not.
Hello?  Anybody there?  ...Guess not.
I am a STICK!  Tee hee.
I am Groot?  Nope, nothing.
Somehow I don't imagine it would be a very stimulating conversation.
There's something... white - and moving - deeper into the forest.
The trees are too thick to go over there, though.
There's something there, but there are too many trees to get close.
There's something out there where the brush gets dense.
I could almost swear that it's closer now.
Maybe if I had arms like Elastigirl.
It moves quickly.  Even if I could reach it, I'm not sure I could catch it.
It's just too far awa-
Well, that's ... very odd.  My fingers just tingled, and
it almost felt as though... no, I must have imagined it.
It claims to be a faerie.  I'm hardly in a position to disagree.
There it goes again.  My fingers are tingling.  And...
...oh my.
Human.  You must stop this at once.
Wha - what are you?!
Ahem.  I think you mean "who".
Yes, sorry!
I am Queen Amai.
That's... interesting and all.  But actually, I think "what" was a perfectly valid question.

Johnny!  Don't be offensive.  Your Majesty... what he means to say is that we've never seen a person like yourself before.  You called me "human" and don't appear to be human yourself.  So please... what are you?
That's what I just asked!
Yes, but you weren't very polite about it.
You are right, I am not a human.  I am Fae.  And it is to be expected that you have never seen a Fae before, as we don't exist in your realm.
I'm sorry, but... that doesn't make any sense.  Do you mean you don't normally exist in our realm?
I do not.  I suppose it was an accident, then, but... you have wandered into our realm.
Oh.  Huh.  Do you think you could tell us how to wander out?
I could...
But?
But it isn't very often that humans find their way here.  And there so happens to be an important task that cannot be done by any Fae.  If you do this thing for us, then I will gladly help you leave.
No, please, we need to get home.
I'm afraid I cannot pass up this opportunity.  My own son, the Crown Prince... he has been taken captive.  Or... killed.  But I must know which.  He must be rescued, or avenged.
Surely there's nothing we can do that you cannot?

If only that were so.  But many years ago, another human entered this realm.  And once here, he devised some magical means by which to render us helpless.  He created a beacon, to call us in, and a weapon to make us lose our power if we got too close.  He caught several Fae in his trap before we realized there was even any danger.  Once we did, we stayed away.  There was no sense risking more Fae to his evils.  Instead, we waited a hundred and fifty years.  Mortal life-spans are so short; it should have been safe.  Prince Ril claimed the honour of entering the wizard's demesne.  But he, too, did not return.  We cannot risk another, but what if Ril still lives?
I'm sure we'd love to help, but it's no safer for us -
But it is!  His magics are aimed against the Fae only.
How can you know that?
Why, you've already wandered through his trap and never even noticed it.  It will not touch you.
Sounds like a swell guy.  What if he tries to kill us?
He is surely dead.  But even if not - you are not without defenses.  Humans have innate magics, the purple one has already displayed hers...
What?
Your magic.
Sorry to disappoint you, but humans don't have magic.

In this realm, you do.  I cannot tell you what it is, except that it will be innately tied to your personality.  When you try to do something that would otherwise be impossible... here, it will be possible for you.  The purple one -
Sarah.

The... the Sarah, her magic is to teleport things a short distance.  I felt it when she pulled me.  If a Fae enters the wizard's demense, they become completely helpless within minutes, and so weak-willed that they willingly go further into the trap no matter the pleas of the rest of us.  You, I can see were not affected in either manner.  And your magics may serve to further protect you.
It's still dangerous!
That is true, human.  However, I cannot allow you to leave otherwise.  Your lives - or perhaps the life of just one of you - cannot be weighed against the life of my son.
You're a coward, not to go yourself.
Johnny!
That may be true.  And yet my life would be lost, while yours only might be.  I will not change my mind.
